member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.OnErrorEncountered(System.Exception)
member.summary: Should be called by the implementation in case of any fatal errors during execution. Stops the instance depending on the value of HaltOnError.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.SubscribeForSignalChanges(System.EventHandler{Visogram.Framework.Collections.ModuleSignalsChangedEventArgs})
member.summary: Notifies the when changes to this instance's input or output signals occur.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.UnsubscribeFromSignalChanges(System.EventHandler{Visogram.Framework.Collections.ModuleSignalsChangedEventArgs})
member.summary: Stops notifications from being sent to the when inputs or outputs change.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.Enable
member.summary: Tries to start the instance by setting HasError to false and Running to true and subsequently calling OnStart

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.Disable
member.summary: Tries to stop the instance by calling OnStop() and sets Running to false regardless of the success in doing so.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.SetProperty``1(System.String,``0@,``0)
member.summary: Helper function for setting a property to a new value and subseqeuently notifying people a change happened. Checks property and value for equality and returns false without any action if equality is detected.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.OnEnabled
member.summary: Called by Start()

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.OnDisabled
member.summary: Called by Stop()

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.GenerateNewUuid
member.summary: Generates a new unique id for this instance. Is used after loading a persisted state to ensure uniqueness despite possible duplicates.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.SubscribeForPropertyChanges(System.EventHandler{Visogram.Framework.Api.PropertyChangedEventArgs})
member.summary: Register only for property changes fired by this module

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.UnsubscribeFromPropertyChanges(System.EventHandler{Visogram.Framework.Api.PropertyChangedEventArgs})
member.summary: Stops the given from receiving notifications.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.RetrieveSignalSource(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves an output with the given

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.RetrieveSignalSink(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves an input with the given

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.RetrieveSignal(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves an input or output with the given

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.CreateFromDescription(System.Xml.Linq.XElement)
member.summary: Creates an instance of a module based on the root node of the persisted instance.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.ReadFromElement(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,Visogram.Framework.PersistenceWarningCollection)
member.summary: Restores a saved state of this instance from an XML node.
member.param: The XML node containing the persisted state

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.OnModuleLoadedFromStore
member.summary: Called after the Module was restored from a persistent state

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.WriteXml(System.Xml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Saves the current state of this instance to a XML stream. By default serializes all signals plus Properties and Fields marked with VSPersistentAttribute Override this in a derived class if you need custom serialization done.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.ToString
member.summary: Returns the module type in a prettified format and the instance's uuid.
member.returns: A string identifying this instance. "VSSignalFramework.ModuleBase (7817b7d26f214ed1ba4184ae265e15fe)"

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.Clone
member.summary: Calls with value true
member.returns: The cloned module instance

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.Clone(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a clone of this module instance. This is done by first serializing the instance to memory and deserializing it afterwards. Clones the entire object tree including eventual instances held by a Container.
member.param: Whether to generate new uuids for instances and signals of the clone
member.returns: The cloned module instance

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.OnModuleCloned(Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase)
member.summary: Called on the instance clone after it was created completely but before generating new uuids. Does not do anything by default.
member.param: The instance this clone was made from

member.name: P:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.Icon
member.summary: Ensures unlimited lifetime needed for remoting to work as expected.

member.name: P:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.ErrorSignal
member.summary: Returns the default error signal for this module.

member.name: P:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.QueuedForStart
member.summary: Used by the loading code to start plugins that were previously running

member.name: P:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.Disabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the current state of execution.

member.name: P:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.HaltOnError
member.summary: Sets the behaviour of the error-catching mechanism. If an error is encountered and this is set to true, Stop is called.

member.name: P:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.ExternalApi
member.summary: Exposes this module to the external API. When true, Properties, Inputs and Outputs become externally accessible.

member.name: P:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.HasError
member.summary: Indicates whether and error was caught during the execution of this module.

member.name: P:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.Inputs
member.summary: The available inputs of this instance.

member.name: P:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.Outputs
member.summary: The available outputs of this instance.

member.name: E:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.UnhandledException
member.summary: Fires when an exception is caught inside this module, but no listener was connected to the ErrorSignal

member.name: E:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.SignalsChanged
member.summary: Is fired when inputs or outputs are added or removed to or from this instance. Can and will be overwritten to support propagation of notificatinos important for Containers. Containers report signal changes of children because they are important to the Container's observer.

member.name: P:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.Name
member.summary: The name of this instance. Unique inside the parent Container.

member.name: P:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.Uuid
member.summary: A globally unique identifier for this module instance. Changes every time the instance is loaded from a persistent state in order to ensure uniqueness when the same file is loaded multiple times into different containers.

member.name: E:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.PropertyChanged
member.summary: Is fired when a property of this module changes. Can and will be overwritten to support propagation of property changes important for Containers. Containers report property changes of children if they are of interest to the Container's observer. This is for example true for the properties "Running", "Name" and "HasError".

member.name: P:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.UniqueName
member.summary: This property is used by the parent module (usually a Container) to ensure uniqueness of the instance name.

member.name: P:Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase.IsRemovable
member.summary: Prevents this module from being removable from its Container by the API (it is still removable by code).

member.name: M:Visogram.Modules.OneToOneModuleBase`2.OutputRequestReceived(System.Object,Visogram.Framework.SignalRequestEventArgs{`1})
member.summary: Override this method to implement "request-style" signalling. By default, this method is empty, so you don't need to call base.OutputRequestReceived.
member.remarks: You don't need to catch Exceptions in your implementation of this method, as they are catched by the base class OneToOneModuleBase

member.name: M:Visogram.Modules.ConverterBase`2.GetOutputForInputObject(Visogram.Framework.SignalEventArgs{`0})
member.summary: Implement this function in a subclass to provide input/output conversion. Exceptions thrown in this function are catched by the VSConverterBase and emit an Error signal. Depending on the setting of , the module is automatically halted or continues execution.

member.name: M:Visogram.Modules.ConverterBase`2.OutputRequestReceived(System.Object,Visogram.Framework.SignalRequestEventArgs{`1})
member.summary: OutputRequestReceived in ConverterBase calls RequestSignal on the converter's default input and uses the converter's conversion implementation GetOutputForInputObject to generate a corresponding output signal which is then returned.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ContainerInputSignal`1.#ctor(Visogram.Framework.ISignalSource,Visogram.Framework.ISignalSink)
member.summary: Creates a ContainerInputSignal while at the same time connecting the ContainerInputSignal's input to the provided and the 'internal' output to the sink provided.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.ContainerOutputSignal`1.#ctor(Visogram.Framework.ISignalSource,Visogram.Framework.ISignalSink)
member.summary: Creates a ContainerOutputSignal while at the same time connecting the ContainerOutputSignal's 'internal' input to the provided and the output to the 'external' sink provided.

member.name: P:Visogram.Framework.ISignalBase.RetainLastDataObject
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this signal should save the last object that was passed through it.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.SignalBase`1.HandleEmitSignal(System.Object)

member.summary: Gets or sets whether this signal should save the last object that was passed through it.

member.summary: Returns the last object that was sent through this signal connector

member.summary: Returns the full name of the (base)type of objects this connector can handle (Type.FullName only, does not include version or assembly information)

member.remarks: This needs to be public in order for remoting to be able to call it

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.SignalSource`1.EmitExclusiveSignal(`0,Visogram.Framework.ISignalSink)
member.summary: Emits a signal only to a specific signal sink

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Container.OnPropertyChanged(System.Object,Visogram.Framework.Api.PropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.remarks: This needs to be public in order to be able to have it called from the remote side

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Container.OnModulePropertyChanged(System.Object,Visogram.Framework.Api.PropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.remarks: This needs to be public in order to be able to have it called from the remote side

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Container.Clear
member.summary: Deletes all instances from this container

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Container.AddModulesFromContainer(Visogram.Framework.Container)
member.summary: Adds all modules found in otherContainer to this container. Be sure to dispose of the otherContainer afterwards, don't use it anymore!

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Container.AddModule(Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase)
member.summary: Adds a new module to the collection using an auto-generated identifier using the format "MyModuleName" for the first module, "MyModuleName1" for the second and so forth.
member.remarks: This method is not threadsafe. Do not call this method from multiple threads, race conditions may cause the same identifier getting used twice resulting in an Exception plus the underlying list is not threadsafe in itself.
member.returns: The identifier that was used

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Container.GetUniqueName(System.String)
member.summary: Appends an increasing number to the given until an unoccupied name is found.
member.remarks: This method is not threadsafe and thus should only be called inside a lock to instances

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Container.AddModule(Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new module using the given
member.remarks: The given identifier must not necessarily be used as the real identifier. If the collection already contains a module by that name, a number is appended to the name to ensure uniqueness. This method is not threadsafe. Do not call this method from multiple threads, race conditions may cause the same identifier getting used twice resulting in an Exception plus the underlying list is not threadsafe in itself.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Container.OnModuleAdded(Visogram.Framework.ModuleBase,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called when module is added

member.summary: Types implementing this interface need to have one parameterless constructor!

member.summary: Override this and provide your own subclass of UiElementSurrogate in order to pass data from here to your JavaScript implementation

member.summary: This function is the default "unkown command" handler and throws an exception by default. If a subclass wants to handle unkown commands it's own way, for example to provide dynamic behaviour, it should override this function.

member.name: T:Fantail.Libraries.Syslog.SyslogMessage
member.summary: Encapsulates a single syslog message, as received from a remote host.

member.name: M:Fantail.Libraries.Syslog.SyslogMessage.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.DateTime,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the SyslogMessage class.
member.param: Specifies the encoded PRI field, containing the facility and severity values.
Specifies the timestamp, if present in the packet.
Specifies the hostname, if present in the packet. The hostname can only be present if the timestamp is also present (RFC3164).
Specifies the textual content of the message.

member.name: M:Fantail.Libraries.Syslog.SyslogMessage.ToString
member.summary: Returns a textual representation of the syslog message, for debugging purposes.

member.name: P:Fantail.Libraries.Syslog.SyslogMessage.Facility
member.summary: Returns an integer specifying the facility. The following are commonly used: 0 kernel messages 1 user-level messages 2 mail system 3 system daemons 4 security/authorization messages (note 1) 5 messages generated internally by syslogd 6 line printer subsystem 7 network news subsystem 8 UUCP subsystem 9 clock daemon (note 2) 10 security/authorization messages (note 1) 11 FTP daemon 12 NTP subsystem 13 log audit (note 1) 14 log alert (note 1) 15 clock daemon (note 2) 16 local use 0 (local0) 17 local use 1 (local1) 18 local use 2 (local2) 19 local use 3 (local3) 20 local use 4 (local4) 21 local use 5 (local5) 22 local use 6 (local6) 23 local use 7 (local7)

member.name: P:Fantail.Libraries.Syslog.SyslogMessage.Severity
member.summary: Returns an integer number specifying the severity. The following values are commonly used: 0 Emergency: system is unusable 1 Alert: action must be taken immediately 2 Critical: critical conditions 3 Error: error conditions 4 Warning: warning conditions 5 Notice: normal but significant condition 6 Informational: informational messages 7 Debug: debug-level messages

member.name: P:Fantail.Libraries.Syslog.SyslogMessage.Timestamp
member.summary: Returns a DateTime specifying the moment at which the event is known to have happened. As per RFC3164, if the host does not send this value, it may be added by a relay.

member.name: P:Fantail.Libraries.Syslog.SyslogMessage.Hostname
member.summary: Returns the DNS hostname where the message originated, or the IP address if the hostname is unknown.

member.name: P:Fantail.Libraries.Syslog.SyslogMessage.Message
member.summary: Returns a string indicating the textual content of the message.

member.name: M:Fantail.Libraries.Syslog.MessageReceivedEventArgs.#ctor(Fantail.Libraries.Syslog.SyslogMessage)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the MessageReceivedEventArgs class.

member.name: P:Fantail.Libraries.Syslog.MessageReceivedEventArgs.SyslogMessage
member.summary: Returns the syslog message as received from the remote host.

member.name: T:Fantail.Libraries.Syslog.SyslogListener
member.summary: Implements a syslog message listener which is RFC3164 compliant.

member.name: M:Fantail.Libraries.Syslog.SyslogListener.#ctor(System.Net.IPAddress)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the SyslogListener class.
member.param: Specifies the address to listen on. IPAddress.Any will bind the listener to all available interfaces.

member.name: M:Fantail.Libraries.Syslog.SyslogListener.Start
member.summary: Starts listening for syslog packets.

member.name: M:Fantail.Libraries.Syslog.SyslogListener.DoReceiveData(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: This internal method processes an async receive as set up by SetupReceive()

member.name: M:Fantail.Libraries.Syslog.SyslogListener.Stop
member.summary: Stops listening and reporting syslog message packets.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Plugins.PluginManager.DiscoverPlugin(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to load the plugin description located in packagePath and builds a PluginInfo out of the information collected. Additionally to returning the discovered information, it is also appenden to the internal list of available plugins

member.summary:
Registers a settings file for the plugin that contains the given .
Settings with the same are shared between all modules in the same plugin as and are threadsafe.
This function is threadsafe.

member.summary: Registers a settings file with autoLoad set to true

member.summary: Registers a settings file called "PluginSettings.xml" with autoLoad set to true

member.summary: Endianness of a converter

member.summary: Little endian - least significant byte first

member.name: F:Visogram.Framework.Utils.Endianness.BigEndian
member.summary: Big endian - most significant byte first

member.name: T:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader
member.summary: Equivalent of System.IO.BinaryReader, but with either endianness, depending on the EndianBitConverter it is constructed with. No data is buffered in the reader; the client may seek within the stream at will.

member.name: F:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.disposed
member.summary: Whether or not this reader has been disposed yet.

member.name: F:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.decoder
member.summary: Decoder to use for string conversions.

member.name: F:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.buffer
member.summary: Buffer used for temporary storage before conversion into primitives

member.name: F:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.charBuffer
member.summary: Buffer used for temporary storage when reading a single character

member.name: F:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.minBytesPerChar
member.summary: Minimum number of bytes used to encode a character

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.#ctor(Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Equivalent of System.IO.BinaryWriter, but with either endianness, depending on the EndianBitConverter it is constructed with.
member.param: Converter to use when reading data

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.#ctor(Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter,System.IO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Constructs a new binary reader with the given bit converter, reading to the given stream, using the given encoding.
member.param: Converter to use when reading data
Encoding to use when reading character data

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.Close
member.summary: Closes the reader, including the underlying stream..

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.Seek(System.Int32,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Seeks within the stream.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a single byte from the stream.
member.returns: The byte read

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.ReadSByte
member.summary: Reads a single signed byte from the stream.
member.returns: The byte read

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.ReadBoolean
member.summary: Reads a boolean from the stream. 1 byte is read.
member.returns: The boolean read

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.ReadInt16
member.summary: Reads a 16-bit signed integer from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 2 bytes are read.
member.returns: The 16-bit integer read

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.ReadInt32
member.summary: Reads a 32-bit signed integer from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 4 bytes are read.
member.returns: The 32-bit integer read

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.ReadInt64
member.summary: Reads a 64-bit signed integer from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 8 bytes are read.
member.returns: The 64-bit integer read

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.ReadUInt16
member.summary: Reads a 16-bit unsigned integer from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 2 bytes are read.
member.returns: The 16-bit unsigned integer read

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.ReadUInt32
member.summary: Reads a 32-bit unsigned integer from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 4 bytes are read.
member.returns: The 32-bit unsigned integer read

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.ReadUInt64
member.summary: Reads a 64-bit unsigned integer from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 8 bytes are read.
member.returns: The 64-bit unsigned integer read

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.ReadSingle
member.summary: Reads a single-precision floating-point value from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 4 bytes are read.
member.returns: The floating point value read

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.ReadDouble
member.summary: Reads a double-precision floating-point value from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 8 bytes are read.
member.returns: The floating point value read

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.ReadDecimal
member.summary: Reads a decimal value from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 16 bytes are read.
member.returns: The decimal value read

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.Read
member.summary: Reads a single character from the stream, using the character encoding for this reader. If no characters have been fully read by the time the stream ends, -1 is returned.
member.returns: The character read, or -1 for end of stream.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.Read(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of characters into the given buffer, starting at the given index.
member.param: The buffer to copy data into
The first index to copy data into
The number of characters to read
member.returns: The number of characters actually read. This will only be less than the requested number of characters if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of bytes into the given buffer, starting at the given index.
member.param: The buffer to copy data into
The first index to copy data into
The number of bytes to read
member.returns: The number of bytes actually read. This will only be less than the requested number of bytes if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.ReadBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of bytes, returning them in a new byte array. If not enough bytes are available before the end of the stream, this method will return what is available.
member.param: The number of bytes to read
member.returns: The bytes read

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.ReadBytesOrThrow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of bytes, returning them in a new byte array. If not enough bytes are available before the end of the stream, this method will throw an IOException.
member.param: The number of bytes to read
member.returns: The bytes read

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.Read7BitEncodedInt
member.summary: Reads a 7-bit encoded integer from the stream. This is stored with the least significant information first, with 7 bits of information per byte of value, and the top bit as a continuation flag. This method is not affected by the endianness of the bit converter.
member.returns: The 7-bit encoded integer read from the stream.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.ReadBigEndian7BitEncodedInt
member.summary: Reads a 7-bit encoded integer from the stream. This is stored with the most significant information first, with 7 bits of information per byte of value, and the top bit as a continuation flag. This method is not affected by the endianness of the bit converter.
member.returns: The 7-bit encoded integer read from the stream.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.ReadString
member.summary: Reads a length-prefixed string from the stream, using the encoding for this reader. A 7-bit encoded integer is first read, which specifies the number of bytes to read from the stream. These bytes are then converted into a string with the encoding for this reader.
member.returns: The string read from the stream.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.CheckDisposed
member.summary: Checks whether or not the reader has been disposed, throwing an exception if so.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.ReadInternal(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the given number of bytes from the stream, throwing an exception if they can't all be read.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.TryReadInternal(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the given number of bytes from the stream if possible, returning the number of bytes actually read, which may be less than requested if (and only if) the end of the stream is reached.
member.returns: Number of bytes actually read

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the underlying stream.

member.name: P:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.BitConverter
member.summary: The bit converter used to read values from the stream

member.name: P:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.Encoding
member.summary: The encoding used to read strings

member.name: P:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryReader.BaseStream
member.summary: Gets the underlying stream of the EndianBinaryReader.

member.name: P:Visogram.Framework.PropertyAttribute.ReadOnly
member.summary: Normally, this value is determined by the Property you set this attribute on. If it has a setter (is writeable), it is set to false, otherwise it is set to true. But you can override the value by specifying it in this Attribute's constructor

member.name: T:Visogram.Framework.Global
member.summary: Have to be set by the hosting environment (Visogram.Host in most cases)

member.summary: Equivalent of System.IO.BinaryWriter, but with either endianness, depending on the EndianBitConverter it is constructed with.

member.summary: Whether or not this writer has been disposed yet.

member.summary: Buffer used for temporary storage during conversion from primitives

member.summary: Constructs a new binary writer with the given bit converter, writing to the given stream, using UTF-8 encoding.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryWriter.#ctor(Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter,System.IO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Constructs a new binary writer with the given bit converter, writing to the given stream, using the given encoding.
member.param: Converter to use when writing data
Encoding to use when writing character data

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryWriter.Close
member.summary: Closes the writer, including the underlying stream.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryWriter.Flush
member.summary: Flushes the underlying stream.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryWriter.Seek(System.Int32,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Seeks within the stream.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryWriter.Write(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes a boolean value to the stream. 1 byte is written.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryWriter.Write(System.Int16)
member.summary: Writes a 16-bit signed integer to the stream, using the bit converter for this writer. 2 bytes are written.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryWriter.Write(System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a 32-bit signed integer to the stream, using the bit converter for this writer. 4 bytes are written.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryWriter.Write(System.Int64)
member.summary: Writes a 64-bit signed integer to the stream, using the bit converter for this writer. 8 bytes are written.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryWriter.Write(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Writes a 16-bit unsigned integer to the stream, using the bit converter for this writer. 2 bytes are written.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryWriter.Write(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Writes a 32-bit unsigned integer to the stream, using the bit converter for this writer. 4 bytes are written.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryWriter.Write(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Writes a 64-bit unsigned integer to the stream, using the bit converter for this writer. 8 bytes are written.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryWriter.Write(System.Single)
member.summary: Writes a single-precision floating-point value to the stream, using the bit converter for this writer. 4 bytes are written.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryWriter.Write(System.Double)
member.summary: Writes a double-precision floating-point value to the stream, using the bit converter for this writer. 8 bytes are written.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryWriter.Write(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Writes a decimal value to the stream, using the bit converter for this writer. 16 bytes are written.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryWriter.Write(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a signed byte to the stream.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryWriter.Write(System.SByte)

member.summary: Writes an array of bytes to the stream.

The index of the first byte to write within the array
The number of bytes to write

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBinaryWriter.Write7BitEncodedInt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a 7-bit encoded integer from the stream. This is stored with the least significant information first, with 7 bits of information per byte of value, and the top bit as a continuation flag.
member.param: The 7-bit encoded integer to write to the stream

member.summary: Checks whether or not the writer has been disposed, throwing an exception if so.

The number of bytes to write

member.name: T:Visogram.Framework.Utils.LittleEndianBitConverter
member.summary: Implementation of EndianBitConverter which converts to/from little-endian byte arrays.

member.name: T:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter
member.summary: Equivalent of System.BitConverter, but with either endianness.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter.IsLittleEndian
member.summary: Indicates the byte order ("endianess") in which data is converted using this class.
member.remarks: Different computer architectures store data using different byte orders. "Big-endian" means the most significant byte is on the left end of a word. "Little-endian" means the most significant byte is on the right end of a word.
member.returns: true if this converter is little-endian, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter.DoubleToInt64Bits(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts the specified double-precision floating point number to a 64-bit signed integer. Note: the endianness of this converter does not affect the returned value.
member.returns: A 64-bit signed integer whose value is equivalent to value.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter.Int64BitsToDouble(System.Int64)
member.summary: Converts the specified 64-bit signed integer to a double-precision floating point number. Note: the endianness of this converter does not affect the returned value.
member.returns: A double-precision floating point number whose value is equivalent to value.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter.SingleToInt32Bits(System.Single)
member.summary: Converts the specified single-precision floating point number to a 32-bit signed integer. Note: the endianness of this converter does not affect the returned value.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer whose value is equivalent to value.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter.Int32BitsToSingle(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the specified 32-bit signed integer to a single-precision floating point number. Note: the endianness of this converter does not affect the returned value.
member.returns: A single-precision floating point number whose value is equivalent to value.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter.ToBoolean(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value converted from one byte at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: true if the byte at startIndex in value is nonzero; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter.ToChar(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a Unicode character converted from two bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A character formed by two bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter.ToDouble(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a double-precision floating point number converted from eight bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A double precision floating point number formed by eight bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter.ToSingle(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a single-precision floating point number converted from four bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A single precision floating point number formed by four bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.summary: Returns a 16-bit signed integer converted from two bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A 16-bit signed integer formed by two bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.summary: Returns a 32-bit signed integer converted from four bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer formed by four bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.summary: Returns a 64-bit signed integer converted from eight bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A 64-bit signed integer formed by eight bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.summary: Returns a 16-bit unsigned integer converted from two bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A 16-bit unsigned integer formed by two bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.summary: Returns a 32-bit unsigned integer converted from four bytes at a specified position in a byte array.

member.summary: Returns a 64-bit unsigned integer converted from eight bytes at a specified position in a byte array.

member.summary: Checks the given argument for validity.
member.exception: startIndex is less than zero or greater than the length of value minus bytesRequired.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter.CheckedFromBytes(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks the arguments for validity before calling FromBytes (which can therefore assume the arguments are valid).
member.param: The bytes to convert after checking
The index of the first byte to convert
The number of bytes to convert

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter.FromBytes(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Convert the given number of bytes from the given array, from the given start position, into a long, using the bytes as the least significant part of the long. By the time this is called, the arguments have been checked for validity.
member.param: The index of the first byte to convert
The number of bytes to use in the conversion
member.returns: The converted number

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter.ToString(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Returns a String converted from the elements of a byte array.
member.remarks: All the elements of value are converted.
member.returns: A String of hexadecimal pairs separated by hyphens, where each pair represents the corresponding element in value; for example, "7F-2C-4A".

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter.ToString(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a String converted from the elements of a byte array starting at a specified array position.
member.remarks: The elements from array position startIndex to the end of the array are converted.
member.returns: A String of hexadecimal pairs separated by hyphens, where each pair represents the corresponding element in value; for example, "7F-2C-4A".

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter.ToString(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a String converted from a specified number of bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.param: The number of bytes to convert.
member.remarks: The length elements from array position startIndex are converted.
member.returns: A String of hexadecimal pairs separated by hyphens, where each pair represents the corresponding element in value; for example, "7F-2C-4A".

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.Utils.EndianBitConverter.ToDecimal(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a decimal value converted from sixteen bytes at a specified position in a byte array.
member.returns: A decimal formed by sixteen bytes beginning at startIndex.

member.name: M:Visogram.Framework.TypeManager.Resolve(System.String)
member.summary:
Resolves a into the corresponding type. Lookups are done against the following sources (in that order)
Type aliases dictionary
VSSignalFramework assembly and mscorlib
Types loaded from plugins
member.param: The type name as a string. For nested types, you need to provide the full CLS name like so: "System.Collections.IList1[[System.String]]", but normally the full name (type name including namespace) is sufficient. You may optionally provide the assembly if the type is not located in one of the sources listed in the description. It could look like the following: "System.Data.IDbConnection, IDbConnection"
member.returns: The type that the represents if found, null otherwise
